name: gauchely
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If someone behaves gauchely, they behave in an awkward and uncomfortable way with other people, especially because they are young and without experience: Apart from the gauchely expressed views of a few teenagers, the topic of youth culture is hardly discussed. At this moment, the maid pushed open the door and came gauchely into the room.
More examplesFewer examplesAfter a series of gauchely flirtatious online exchanges, they arrange to meet.The dress hung gauchely, making her seem much younger.At the end, he is joined by a dance troupe, rather gauchely simulating a train.
